Instruction: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a well-seasoned cast iron skillet with the shortening, and place it in the oven as it preheats.
Combine the flour and milk in a bowl, whisking until a thick yet flowing batter forms.
Sprinkle a pinch of garlic salt over the bottom of the hot greased skillet. Pour in the batter, then sprinkle the top with another pinch of garlic salt.
Mix together sugar, flour, cocoa in a bowl, stir in water, and bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir occasionally until thick, then remove from heat, add butter and serve over biscuits. Enjoy!
Substitute bacon grease or canola oil for the shortening if desired.
